result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas Patrick McDonald was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicholas Patrick McDonald is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nicholas Patrick McDonald was found guilty of Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Nicholas Patrick McDonald was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 1 and 4.
Defendant to report to Probation on December 12, 2014 by 4:00 p.m.
Defendant can apply for expungement upon successful completion of probation.



In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

records.addlTxt: c: Def, Atty, DA, Jail & E: Probation. eif

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle  DF:  Nicholas Patrick McDonald appeared from jail, pro se. Probation Agent Emily Anderson appears via phone. Case called at 11:34 a.m. Court notes this matter was set for a review hearing. Letter was received by probation agent requesting additional jail time. Defendant does not have an attorney. Agent Anderson states received notice from public defender's office that defendant did not have contact with their office. DE would like to continue today without an attorney. Agent Anderson makes statement and is still requesting 40 days additional jail time. DE makes statement. Court will amend the JOC to add 40 days conditional jail time. 14 days credit for time served from December 10, 2015.
Filed by Agent Anderson. Re: status of Def. km

CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Webb, ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes, DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski, DF: Nicholas Patrick McDonald appeared.  Court called at 4:24 p.m.  DE files Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Victim Rights have been complied with.  Court reads charges and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to Ct. 2 (misdemeanor trespass) and Ct. 3 (misdemeanor theft and party to a the crime).  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty to Ct 2 (misdemeanor trespass) and Ct. 3 (misdemeanor theft and party to a the crime).  On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct. 1 & Ct. 4. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

S/W 1 year probation
-DE to obtain GED or HSED
-Restorative Justice Program if victim requests
-Apology letter to victim
-15 hours Community Service 
-Restitution of $424.24 payable through DOC
-DNA surcharge of $200 for Ct. 2 and DNA surcharge of $200 for Ct. 3
-DE to report to probation by 4:00 p.m. on 12/12/14.
-DE can apply for expungement at completion of probation
-20 days to appeal
Status conference on December 11, 2014 at 04:15 pm.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Webb. ADA:  Kevin H. Gehler, DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski did not appear, DF: Nicholas Patrick McDonald appeared.  Court called at 4:46 p.m.  Attorney Kucinski did not appear.  Court advises the DE the hearing cannot proceed without his counsel present.  Court continues the STC.  Court adjourned at 4:48 p.m. lw  Status conference scheduled for December 11, 2014 at 04:15 pm.
Status conference on November 13, 2014 at 04:30 pm.

Atty Kucinski states there is a possible resolution. Court sets for continued status.  Status conference scheduled for November 13, 2014 at 04:30 pm.

Pre-trial conference on July 28, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Douglas Bugni or the property at 1677 County Road TT, Hammond, WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Must attend school.  

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
